channel.title: The Power of Flash
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KcKvS983K8c
This is the power of Flashes new hardware accelerated 3D (or 2D). They will release Flash Player 11 PUBLIC in a month or 2. (Everyone can get an incubator build to test out Flash Player 11 programs like the game on the video for example.)
I'm tired of all the pre-judgements of people telling flash sucks. _________________________________________________________ Some other demos:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uYgOxzQ6bNU
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UZb1huF7Np0
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JSlehUCU9gs __________________________________________________ Download an incubator build of Flash Player 11 here: http://labs.adobe.com/downloads/flashplatformruntimes_incubator.html ___________________________________________________________________ Also, in the Creative Suite 5, you can make local apps for Android, Iphone, Blackberry,... So guess what, Flash is just beginning.

item.title: The Power of Flash
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok. well like i said flash is going to have to do a lot to make like it. pretty much the only flash i use is youtube. i dont play flash games b/c the experience ive had in the past is most dissatisfactory.

Read full topic

item.title: The Power of Flash
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:9, topic:401799”]ok well we all have the right to our opinion. im stubborn and it takes a lot of fact to change what i want to believe, and even then i may not change. coppercube also have their product for html5 im quite sure it wouldnt take much to port any of those game engines for use with html5 since javascript and actionscript are similar.[/quote]No, coppercube rewrote their entire engine for HTML5, actionscript and javascript are similair when writing them, but they have a completely different context. In order to port a game written in one of those engines to HTML5, the makers have to rewrite their entire engine. Also, those engines are basicly extentions to Flash, you have to download their API into flash, and the flash compiler compiles the games. CopperCube is a bit different from the other API’s because it has it’s own client, when developing in CopperCube it’s like developing in a completely different platform that can export your project as a swf file. That is why there is compability for HTML5 as well, they wrote their own engine for making 3D applications and they used the core of Flash and HTML5 to export it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Power of Flash
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

ok well we all have the right to our opinion. im stubborn and it takes a lot of fact to change what i want to believe, and even then i may not change. coppercube also have their product for html5 im quite sure it wouldnt take much to port any of those game engines for use with html5 since javascript and actionscript are similar.

Read full topic

item.title: The Power of Flash
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:7, topic:401799”]the only good flash ive seen is from molehill or their gfx engine. flash is going to have to get a lot better to impress me. flash cant be better than webgl. i havent looked but are they using opengl, or their own gfx library implementation ? how much does it cost to develop in flash? upgrading is $50 so buying it brand new is idk couldnt find the price with a quick scan of their site. how much to develop html5? free, as much as u want to spend on, if u buy some kind of development suite and engine. point is flash is just now catching up, with the noobie.

http://www.youtube.com/v/YY7J6xIkt9M[/quote]The new flash player uses OpenGL and Direct3D (DirectX) also, with the new platform you can develop local applications for almost every platform. They have their own GFX library implementation called Stage3D but they also have teamed up with Alternativa3D, Away3d, CopperCube, Flare3D, Minko, Sophie3D and Yogurt3D wich gives developers huge variation in developing 3D. Flash is better because it has been developed since 1996 and is extremely stable.

The language is ActionScript wich is based on ECMAScript, just like Javascript. And ECMAScript is just awesome, I love to write it.

Flash is better because it is maintained by Adobe. A company with responsibility. How much does it cost? If your a student you can get a copy for 140 dollars.

Also, flash has one of the best text and vector graphics engines.

Read full topic

item.title: The Power of Flash
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

the only good flash ive seen is from molehill or their gfx engine. flash is going to have to get a lot better to impress me. flash cant be better than webgl. i havent looked but are they using opengl, or their own gfx library implementation ? how much does it cost to develop in flash? upgrading is $50 so buying it brand new is idk couldnt find the price with a quick scan of their site. how much to develop html5? free, as much as u want to spend on, if u buy some kind of development suite and engine. point is flash is just now catching up, with the noobie.

http://www.youtube.com/v/YY7J6xIkt9M

This is the power of Flashes new hardware accelerated 3D (or 2D).
They will release Flash Player 11 PUBLIC in a month or 2. (Everyone can get an incubator build to test out Flash Player 11 programs like the game on the video for example.)

I’m tired of all the pre-judgements of people telling flash sucks.
